title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Management
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management             Management        Old Fall River Road gabions NPS       The National Park Service recognizes that managers must prepare for new and changing environments.  This includes planning for different natural resource conditions and providing for modern visitor needs. Special places like Rocky are managed in a way that allows them to be enjoyed for generations to come.  Learn about the National Park Service Call to Action for a new century of stewardship and engagement in our public lands.              Management Plans  The park uses an adaptive management framework. This includes consistent resource monitoring to determine what actions need to be improved.        Our Staff & Offices  Rocky employees serve a variety of roles in a unique office environment.            Laws & Policies  National parks are the crown jewels of protected areas in the nation. Laws & policies help conserve resources and protect visitors.         Park Statistics   Just the facts. The park offers a variety of resources that provide information about the park.         Fire Management  Managing fire in natural ecosystems prepares us for the uncertainty inevitable in a world shaped by human activity.        Elk and Vegetation Management  Natural variability among plant and animal relationships can improve ecosystem resilience.
